title: Whats the hardest role for lowElo?
body: Ive been having arguments with my friend on the hardest role. We are both in silver and would bever agree with eachother.

replies.body:
depends on how you play the role. If you play support with the assumption you have an adc, then support.
Jungle, your laners won't understand jungle pressure, but on the other hand, enemy laners won't ward either.
But generally, adc is hardest since you don't have a support, and low elo players like assassins.
So what would be the easiest?

hmm depends on what your strength is. 

For instance, if you're good at duelists and measuring up in a 1v1, I'd say top. Pick a midgame fighter and splitpush your way to victory.
If you have good mechanics and remember to roam, mid, take a dump on the enemy adc since they will have 0 peel.
If you're good at taking game momentum and running wild with a snowball, jungle. Make the enemy team ff at 15 because their jungle is afk farming whilst you proceed to oneshot anyone who forgets to hug tower.
If you're good at tanks and knowing exactly how much you can do, support tank with ignite. If your adc complains that you haven't given him an assist, mute him.
If you're good at mage/enchanter supports, still take ignite. If you somehow get a competent adc, you'll naturally support them. If they're bad, shields aren't terrible and full ap sona/lulu/karma is still a thing.
If you're good at last hitting and positioning... probably still don't play adc without a reliable duo support.

Support, Support, Support, and Support.

Auto-filled Supports at any ELO are much wow. Much, much wow. Complete and utter passengers who need carriage like a mofo.

Boy, do I hate them.

Personally, I think there are a lot of decent Supports and Jungles out there. Sure, there are more than a few who just can't do sh!t right, but you get that with every position. When it comes down to it, Support and Jungle (more so Support) are the positions that receive the most flak for other peoples mistakes and things they're already doing that people think they aren't (warding and vision control, for example).

With Top and Mid, they're essentially "solo jobs", which I think most low elo players are comfortable with (often being focused on the "individual" and not the "team" aspect). They don't mind being on their own for the most part, and so Top and Mid are ideal for that. Again, there are always those who just can't get sh!t right, but that's (generally) not so much of a problem with Top and Mid, so long as they don't lose their cool.

The real issue is ADC. Part of what makes ADC "unique", in this respect, is that it is the *only* position that is of neither a "support" or "solo" nature, and this causes problems for a lot of players. It should also be noted that there is always significant pressure on the ADC to be getting kills, sometimes so much so that it's considered "above all else", and so effectively creates a "deathmatch" mentality, which isn't ideal for a game like LoL. Not only that, but there is also pressure on the ADC to be the "biggest" damage dealer on the team. When it comes down to it, it's relatively easy to screw up as the ADC, when compared to other positions, since there's so much that's expected of them.

Well, that's my opinion, anyway. Take it or leave it.

Support, taking care of babies and being stuck 1v9 is the life of a low elo support main.

The only time support is easy is when you're duo queued, or you pick an AP mid as "support"
